title: Someone who is not a fan of Russ Breault and the Shroud of Turin
post: So there’s this farmer guy, see!  And he’s got all this seed, like;  But he wants to get the most out of his property and maximise his yield.  So he scatters the seed all over the place!  But what do you know!?  It only ever took root on good ground.  Not sure if there’s a lesson in religious economics there or not!  Maybe it’s over to us to cultivate the ground first.

title: Someone who is not a fan of Russ Breault and the Shroud of Turin
post:
R: Don’t worry, the disciples had to have it explained to them too.
Check out the original version, Parable of the Sower – Matt 13:3-8; Explanation – Matt 13:18-23.
To hear and accept the message, you need the right disposition, whether it’s the gospel, or any other truth whatsoever, even such as “What is the Shroud?”  A closed mind won’t make it – see the lampooning of Christians in the original heading.
But God still wills that all may hear his message.  Maybe we can help those with crippled minds and attitudes, but that kind of soil needs some fairly tough and harsh cultivating.  Hope I’ve made it clearer.  We have a lot of rural countryside in NZ.
author: Daveb of Wellington NZ

title: Someone who is not a fan of Russ Breault and the Shroud of Turin

Hey I understood the parable, from even back when I was a kid, and I’m a city boy ;-). I just wasn’t clear on what you were saying. So as Jesus taught his deciples; tell them, if they don’t hear, walk away…and I try to follow that model.
Ron
